ch.se.inf.ethz.jcd.batman.vdisk

Interface IVirtualDiskSpace

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    VirtualDiskSpace

    public interface IVirtualDiskSpace
    A IVirtualDiskSpace is a simple abstraction of a list of IDataBlock. A virtual disk space allows to work with a continuous space on the disk without handling the jumps between data blocks and the management that is connected with it.

    • Method Summary

      Changes the size of the disk space.
      void free()
      Frees all the DataBlocks used by the disk space.

      Returns the amount of bytes which are needed to represent the disk space including all the meta data used to store the data blocks on the virtual disk.

      Returns the offset position, measured in bytes from the beginning of the disk space.

      Returns the usable size of the disk space.

      Returns the position (address) of the space inside the virtual disk.

    • Method Detail

      • getVirtualDiskPosition

        long getVirtualDiskPosition()
        Returns the position (address) of the space inside the virtual disk. The position 0 would be the first byte of the virtual disk.
        Returns:
        the position (address) of the space inside the virtual disk.

      • changeSize

        void changeSize(long newSize)
                throws IOException
        Changes the size of the disk space. If the new size is smaller than the current size, the additional space is marked as free. If the newSize is bigger, additional DataBlocks are allocated and added to the disk space.
        Parameters:
        newSize - the new size of the disk space
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • getSize

        long getSize()
        Returns the usable size of the disk space.
        Returns:
        the usable size of the disk space

      • getPosition

        long getPosition()
        Returns the offset position, measured in bytes from the beginning of the disk space.
        Returns:
        the offset position.

      • seek

        void seek(long pos)
        Sets the offset position, measured in bytes from the beginning of the disk space. The offset may be set beyond the end of the disk space. Setting the offset beyond the end of the disk space does not change the disk space size. The disk space size will change only by writing after the offset has been set beyond the end of the disk space.
        Parameters:
        pos - the offset position, measured in bytes from the beginning of the disk space.

      • write

        void write(byte b)
           throws IOException
        Writes the specified byte to the disk space at the current offset.
        Parameters:
        b - the byte to be written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • writeLong

        void writeLong(long l)
               throws IOException
        Write the specified long to the disk space at the current offset.
        Parameters:
        l - the long to be written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • write

        void write(byte[] b)
           throws IOException
        Write the specified byte array to the disk space at the current offset.
        Parameters:
        b - the byte array to be written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • write

        void write(long pos,
         byte b)
           throws IOException

        b - the byte to be written

      • read

        byte read()
          throws IOException
        Reads a signed eight-bit value from the disk space at the current offset.
        Returns:
        the next byte of the disk space.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • read

        int read(byte[] b)
         throws IOException
        Reads up to b.length bytes of bytes from the disk space into an array of bytes starting at the current offset.
        Parameters:
        b - the buffer into which the data is read.
        Returns:
        the total number of bytes written into b
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • readLong

        long readLong()
              throws IOException
        Reads a signed 64-bit value from the disk space at the current offset.
        Returns:
        the next long of the disk space.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • read

        byte read(long pos)
          throws IOException
        Reads a signed eight-bit value from the disk space at offset given by pos.
        Parameters:
        pos - the offset at which the byte should be read.
        Returns:
        the byte which was read
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • read

        int read(long pos,
       byte[] b)
         throws IOException
        Reads up to b.length bytes of data from the disk space into an array of bytes starting at the offset given by pos.
        Parameters:
        pos - the offset at which the byte array should be read.
        b - the buffer into which the data is read.
        Returns:
        the total number of bytes written into b
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • readLong

        long readLong(long pos)
              throws IOException
        Reads a signed 64-bit value from the disk space at the offset given by pos.
        Parameters:
        pos - the offset at which the long should be read.
        Returns:
        the long which was read
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • getDiskSize

        long getDiskSize()
        Returns the amount of bytes which are needed to represent the disk space including all the meta data used to store the data blocks on the virtual disk.
        Returns:
        the disk space used by the virtual space on the virtual disk in bytes.

      • free

        void free()
          throws IOException
        Frees all the DataBlocks used by the disk space. The virtual space can't be used after it has been freed.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
